channel.title: DevFreeBooks
channel.description: A collection of free books for devs

item.title: Free book: Angular Testing Succinctly
item.description:
Though sometimes perceived as a hurdle, testing can save developers from heartbreak in the long run. In Angular Testing Succinctly, author Joseph D. Booth provides a quick introduction to different tools and approaches to testing Angular projects to make them higher quality from the start and easier to maintain down the road. Topics covered include lint checking, test-driven development, unit testing, and end-to-end testing. Tools covered include TSLint, ESLint, SonarLint, Karma, Jasmine, Protractor, and Cucumber.
Author: Joseph D. Booth | Category: AngularJS
Lang: EN | Pages: 94 | Year: 2020
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: C++ Succinctly
item.description:
C++ Succinctly was written to help professional C# developers learn modern C++ programming. The aim of this book is to leverage your existing C# knowledge in order to expand your skills. Whether you need to use C++ in an upcoming project, or simply want to learn a new language (or reacquaint yourself with it), this book will help you learn all of the fundamental pieces of C++ so you can begin writing your own C++ programs.
Author: Michael McLaughlin | Category: C/C++
Lang: EN | Pages: 127 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: C# Features Succinctly
item.description:
C# Features Succinctly is a concise guide to the significant features packaged in C# 7, 8, and 9. To help readers understand the evolution of the language, author Dirk Strauss first covers the important additions that arrived in version 7, such as tuples, pattern matching, and out variables. Next, he covers more than a dozen features in version 8, from nullable reference types to unmanaged constructed types. Finally, readers get a taste of the latest features in C# 9, and some of the productivity enhancements provided to .NET developers in Visual Studio.
Author: Dirk Strauss | Category: Csharp
Lang: EN | Pages: 77 | Year: 2021
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Elixir Succinctly
item.description:
Author Emanuele DelBono guides readers along the first steps of mastering the Elixir programming language in Elixir Succinctly. Providing a brief overview of Elixir’s history and purpose and clear instructions to create an app with Elixir, DelBono makes it easy for developers who wish to add a new language to their repertoire.
Author: Emanuele DelBono | Category: Elixir
Lang: EN | Pages: 84 | Year: 2019
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Flutter UI Succinctly
item.description:
Flutter made quite the impact when it landed in the cross-platform mobile framework landscape. Developed by Google, open source, targeting iOS and Android, smooth animations and motion, platform awareness, hot reload—the list of highlights goes on and on, demonstrating why Flutter is a worth any mobile developer’s attention. In Flutter UI Succinctly, Ed Freitas explores the essentials of constructing user interfaces with Flutter, showing off how a handful of Flutter’s built-in widgets and tools can serve as a springboard to creating apps with impressive interfaces.
Author: Ed Freitas | Category: Flutter
Lang: EN | Pages: 123 | Year: 2021
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Go Web Development Succinctly
item.description:
Go is a modern programming language built to deal with modern programming challenges, such as concurrency and compilation. Designed specifically with the web in mind, Go is an excellent language for writing web applications, specifically for web services. In his second book on Go, Mark Lewin will take you through serving, routing, connecting to a data source, using the templating engine, working with cookies, and more. Use Go Web Development Succinctly to build hugely scalable web applications with ease.
Author: Mark Lewin | Category: Go
Lang: EN | Pages: 89 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Go Succinctly
item.description:
The Go programming language is relatively small and concise, but its depth makes it an ideal option for solving modern-day development problems. In Go Succinctly, author Mark Lewin guides readers through the basics of Go, and he provides documentation and resources that allow users to dive into the language and learn it for themselves. By the end of the book, novices and experienced programmers alike will be conversant in a language quickly gaining traction around the world.
Author: Mark Lewin | Category: Go
Lang: EN | Pages: 104 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Groovy Succinctly
item.description:
Groovy is a well-established programming language that offers a number of advantages to developers who want a reliable language with a mature community. With Groovy Succinctly, Duncan Dickinson will introduce Groovy to programmers of all skill levels. Readers will learn the basics of Groovy and will learn how to develop practical applications with its unique features.
Author: Duncan Dickinson | Category: Groovy
Lang: EN | Pages: 104 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Java Succinctly Part 2
item.description:
In this second e-book on Java, Christopher Rose takes readers through some of the more advanced features of the language. Java Succinctly Part 2 explores powerful and practical features of Java, such as multithreading, building GUI applications, and 2-D graphics and game programming. Then learn techniques for using these mechanisms in coherent projects by building a calculator app and a simple game with the author.
Author: Christopher Rose | Category: Java
Lang: EN | Pages: 134 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Java Succinctly Part 1
item.description:
Java is a high-level, cross-platform, object-oriented programming language that allows applications to be written once and run on a multitude of different devices. Java applications are ubiquitous, and the language is consistently ranked as one of the most popular and dominant in the world. Christopher Rose’s Java Succinctly Part 1 describes the foundations of Java–from printing a line of text to the console, to inheritance hierarchies in object-oriented programming. The e-book covers practical aspects of programming, such as debugging and using an IDE, as well as the core mechanics of the language.
Author: Christopher Rose | Category: Java
Lang: EN | Pages: 125 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Leaflet.js Succinctly
item.description:
This introduction to Leaflet.js will teach key concepts of the software and critical techniques in order to help you develop web-ready interactive maps. Mark Lewin's Leaflet.js Succinctly is the first step on the road to producing the best interactive maps you possibly can.
Author: Mark Lewin | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 106 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Electron Succinctly
item.description:
Developing web apps can be made more difficult by the fact that they do not easily or natively run in desktop environments. This can make a variety of development skills useless, reducing the amount of expertise even the best developers can bring to a project and increasing the workload for producing cross-platform apps. But with the Electron framework, web apps can be brought seamlessly to desktop environments, opening up new avenues for developers. In Electron Succinctly, author Ed Freitas serves as a guide to getting started with Electron.
Author: Ed Freitas | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 131 | Year: 2019
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Ionic 4 Succinctly
item.description:
Ionic 4 takes the original Ionic toolkit from a mobile-centric framework based on Angular to a powerful, web-based UI design system and app-development toolset that is JavaScript-framework agnostic. The increased performance of Ionic 4 components makes the framework ideal for developing progressive web apps (PWAs), which are in high demand and popularity these days. With Ionic 4 Succinctly, Ed Freitas will focus on progressive web apps and show you how you can use Ionic 4 to build one, using Vue as the JavaScript framework.Ionic 4 takes the original Ionic toolkit from a mobile-centric framework based on Angular to a powerful, web-based UI design system and app-development toolset that is JavaScript-framework agnostic. The increased performance of Ionic 4 components makes the framework ideal for developing progressive web apps (PWAs), which are in high demand and popularity these days. With Ionic 4 Succinctly, Ed Freitas will focus on progressive web apps and show you how you can use Ionic 4 to build one, using Vue as the JavaScript framework.
Author: Ed Freitas | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 101 | Year: 2020
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Neural Networks with JavaScript Succinctly
item.description:
James McCaffrey leads you through the fundamental concepts of neural networks, including their architecture, input-output, tanh and softmax activation, back-propagation, error and accuracy, normalization and encoding, and model interpretation. Although most concepts are relatively simple, there are many of them, and they interact with each other in unobvious ways, which is a major challenge of neural networks. But you can learn all important neural network concepts by running and examining the code in Neural Networks with JavaScript Succinctly, with complete example programs for the three major types of neural network problems.
Author: James McCaffrey | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 163 | Year: 2019
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: PHP Succinctly
item.description:
Known for its straightforward simplicity, PHP is an open source, general-purpose scripting language oriented for web development. In PHP Succinctly, author José Roberto Olivas Mendoza guides newcomers through PHP’s basics, which includes deployment, programming themes such as variables, decision making, arrays, functions, and databases, and the creation of a functional webpage that will connect to a database. By the end, you’ll be ready to join the vast community of PHP users around the world.
Author: José Roberto Olivas Mendoza | Category: PHP
Lang: EN | Pages: 119 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Python Succinctly
item.description:
Learn to use the Python language to create programs of all kinds. Author Jason Cannon will guide you from complete unfamiliarity with Python to creating practical applications. With Python Succinctly, lack of experience isn't an obstacle to programming language mastery.
Author: Jason Cannon | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 146 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: SciPy Programming Succinctly
item.description:
James McCaffrey’s SciPy Programming Succinctly offers readers a quick, thorough grounding in knowledge of the Python open source extension SciPy. The SciPy library, accompanied by its interdependent NumPy, offers Python programmers advanced functions that work with arrays and matrices. Each section presents a complete demo program for programmers to experiment with, carefully chosen examples to best illustrate each function, and resources for further learning. Use this e-book to install and edit SciPy, and use arrays, matrices, and combinatorics in Python programming.
Author: James McCaffrey | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 120 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Scala Succinctly
item.description:
Learning a new programming language can be a daunting task, but Scala Succinctly makes it a simple matter. Author Chris Rose guides readers through the basics of Scala, from installation to syntax shorthand, so that they can get up and running quickly.
Author: Chris Rose | Category: Scala
Lang: EN | Pages: 110 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Vue.js Succinctly
item.description:
Explore the fundamentals of Vue.js, a top open-source JavaScript framework, and harness its powerful features to build UIs and single-page applications. Succinctly series writer Ed Freitas employs the same principals he used in Flutter Succinctly to teach readers how to build a web app with Vue.js.
Author: Ed Freitas | Category: VueJS
Lang: EN | Pages: 101 | Year: 2020
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: You Don't Know JS Yet: Get Started (2nd Edition)
item.description:
Get Started, the first book in the new edition series, is where to start your journey of knowing JS more deeply. This book surveys the language in multiple layers of detail, laying out a roadmap with the other books as guides for your learning and growth. For any developer hoping to move from early JS experience to a deeper level, here is your first step to get started.
Author: Kyle Simpson | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 145 | Year: 2020
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: You Don't Know JS Yet: Scope & Closures (2nd Edition)
item.description:
Scope & Closures examines all aspects of lexical scope, then builds on these principles to leverage the power of closure, and finally digs into the module pattern for better program structure.
Author: Kyle Simpson | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 281 | Year: 2020
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Flutter Succinctly
item.description:
In Flutter Succinctly, Ed Freitas will take you through creating a fully functional app to help you assess whether Flutter is the right choice for your mobile development needs.
Author: Ed Freitas | Category: Flutter
Lang: EN | Pages: 129 | Year: 2019
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Sponsored book: Beginning App Development with Flutter: Create Cross-Platform Mobile Apps
item.description:
This book breaks down complex concepts and tasks into easily digestible segments with examples, pictures, and hands-on labs with starters and solutions.
Author: Rap Payne | Category: Flutter
Lang: EN | Pages: 336 | Year: 2019
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The Java Web Scraping Handbook
item.description:
This book will teach you how to extract data from any website with Java, how to deal with AJAX / Javascript heavy websites, break captchas, deploy your scrapers in the cloud and many other advanced techniques.
Author: Kevin Sahin | Category: Java
Lang: EN | Pages: 130 | Year: 2019
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Building Browser Extension
item.description:
Get Started with Cross Browser WebExtension Development using Javascript API's.
Author: Viswaprasath | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 74 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: JavaScript RegExp
item.description:
Scripting and automation tasks often need to extract particular portions of text from input data or modify them from one format to another. This book will help you learn JavaScript Regular Expressions, a mini-programming language for all sorts of text processing needs.
Author: Sundeep Agarwal | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 80 | Year: 2020
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Introduction to Computer Networking
item.description:
This in-depth eBook is the definitive resource for perfecting computer networking fundamentals.Perfect for anyone interested in cyber security, network engineering or ethical hacking!
Author: Potato Pirates | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 90 | Year: 2019
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Sponsored book: Pro React 16
item.description:
Best-selling author Adam Freeman explains how to get the most from React. He begins by describing the React architecture and the benefits it offers and then shows you how to use React and its associated tools and libraries in your projects, starting from the nuts and bolts and building up to the most advanced and sophisticated features, going in-depth to give you the knowledge you need.
Author: Adam Freeman | Category: React
Lang: EN | Pages: 772 | Year: 2019
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Flutter Tutorials Handbook
item.description:
This cookbook contains recipes that demonstrate how to solve common problems while writing Flutter apps. Each recipe is self-contained and can be used as a reference to help you build up an application.
Author: Raunak Hajela | Category: Flutter
Lang: EN | Pages: 43 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The JavaScript Handbook
item.description:
JavaScript is one of the most popular programming languages in the world, and now widely used also outside of the browser. The rise of Node.js in the last few years unlocked backend development, once the domain of Java, Ruby, Python, PHP, and more traditional server-side languages. Learn all about it!
Author: Flavio Copes | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 171 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The Node.js Handbook
item.description:
This book is a getting started guide to Node.js, the server-side JavaScript runtime environment. Node.js is built on top of the Google Chrome V8 JavaScript engine, and it's mainly used to create web servers
Author: Flavio Copes | Category: Node.js
Lang: EN | Pages: 189 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The Express.js Handbook
item.description:
Express is a Node.js Web Framework. Node.js is an amazing tool for building networking services and applications. Express builds on top of its features to provide easy to use functionality that satisfy the needs of the Web Server use case.
Author: Flavio Copes | Category: Node.js
Lang: EN | Pages: 61 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The React Handbook
item.description:
The React Handbook follows the 80/20 rule: learn in 20% of the time the 80% of a topic. I find this approach gives a well-rounded overview. This book does not try to cover everything under the sun related to React.
Author: Flavio Copes | Category: React
Lang: EN | Pages: 220 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Flutter Cookbook
item.description:
This cookbook contains recipes that demonstrate how to solve common problems while writing Flutter apps. Each recipe is self-contained and can be used as a reference to help you build up an application.
Author: Google | Category: Flutter
Lang: EN | Pages: 56 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: SQL Server for C# Developers Succinctly
item.description:
Developers of C# applications with a SQL Server database can learn to connect to a database using classic ADO.NET and look at different methods of developing databases using the Entity Framework. This book addresses common pitfalls, why databases run slowly, how to troubleshoot performance issues, and how to test and deploy SQL Server databases. The first half has a focus on C# and development while the second half focuses on troubleshooting using the SQL Server tools.
Author: Sander Rossel | Category: Csharp
Lang: EN | Pages: 96 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: HTML5 Notes for Professionals book
item.description:
The HTML5 Notes for Professionals book is compiled from Stack Overflow Documentation, the content is written by the beautiful people at Stack Overflow. Text content is released under Creative Commons BY-SA. See credits at the end of this book whom contributed to the various chapters. Images may be copyright of their respective owners unless otherwise specified.
Author: GoalKicker | Category: HTML
Lang: EN | Pages: 122 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: JavaScript Notes for Professionals book
item.description:
The JavaScript Notes for Professionals book is compiled from Stack Overflow Documentation, the content is written by the beautiful people at Stack Overflow. Text content is released under Creative Commons BY-SA.
Author: GoalKicker | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 480 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Construindo APIs testáveis com Node.js
item.description:
This ebook uses best practices examples about how to build Node.js and tests APIs; This is a guide for beginners and advanced developers.
Author: Waldemar Neto | Category: Node.js
Lang: BR | Pages: 200 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Aplicações web realtime com Node.js
item.description:
Node.js is a powerful platform. It allows to write serve-side Javascript applications, making use of the language's syntax familiarity to write scalable applications. As Node.js makes use of an object-oriented model and events, focussed in non-blocking I/O, developing on it may be different to whom is used to traditional web applications. In this book, Caio Ribeiro Pereira breaks this wall, clearly showing this paradigm change, besides focusing in importante topics, the main API's and frameworks as Express and Socket.IO.
Author: Caio Ribeiro Pereira | Category: Node.js
Lang: BR | Pages: 185 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think Perl 6 - How to think like a computer scientist
item.description:
Learn programming using the new Perl 6 programming language.
Author: Laurent Rosenfeld & Allen Downey | Category: Perl 6
Lang: EN | Pages: 440 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: TypeScript Notes for Professionals book
item.description:
The TypeScript Notes for Professionals book is compiled from Stack Overflow Documentation, the content is written by the beautiful people at Stack Overflow. Text content is released under Creative Commons BY-SA. See credits at the end of this book whom contributed to the various chapters.
Author: GoalKicker | Category: TypeScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 97 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The Vue Handbook
item.description:
Vue is a very impressive project. It's a very popular JavaScript framework, one that's experiencing a huge growth. In this book you will learn how to use the essential of this simple, tiny and very performant JavaScript framework.
Author: Flavio Copes | Category: VueJS
Lang: EN | Pages: 122 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Python Data Science Handbook
item.description:
Essential Tools for Working with Data
Author: Jake VanderPlas | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 541 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Rails Testing Handbook
item.description:
Tired of fragile code? This free hands-on book will teach you how to build better Rails apps with confidence. Learn practical behavior-driven development (BDD) from the makers of Semaphore CI/CD.
Author: Marko Anastasov, Igor Šarčević | Category: Ruby On Rails
Lang: EN | Pages: 61 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Sponsored book: JavaScript Awesome Tips
item.description:
This is a cookbook with a collection of useful tips and tricks to apply in JavaScript/Node.js, each tip shows a problem and some magical solutions in pratical codes.
Author: Caio R Pereira | Category: JavaScript
Lang: BR | Pages: 50 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Thinking in JavaScript
item.description:
Get started with JavaScript and learn one of the most important languages in web development today. With helpful tips and code examples, discover how you can create websites with impressive and dynamic functionality. Explore JavaScript’s in-built features and find out how to customize them in this accessible and free guide.
Author: Aravind Shenoy | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 31 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: C++
item.description:
The goal of this book is to teach you to think like a computer scientist. I like the way computer scientists think because they combine some of the best features of Mathematics, Engineering, and Natural Science. Like mathematicians, computer scientists use formal languages to denote ideas.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: C/C++
Lang: EN | Pages: 191 | Year: 2012
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: HTML and CSS is hard
item.description:
A friendly web development tutorial for complete beginners.
Author: Oliver James | Category: HTML
Lang: EN | Pages: 200 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think Java
item.description:
Think Java is an introduction to computer science and programming intended for people with little or no experience. We start with the most basic concepts and are careful to define all terms when they are first used.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: Java
Lang: EN | Pages: 291 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think OCalm
item.description:
How to Think Like a Computer Scientist is an introductory programming textbook based on the OCaml language. It is intended for newcomers to programming and also those who know some programming but want to learn programming in the function-oriented paradigm using OCaml.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: OCalm
Lang: EN | Pages: 142 | Year: 2008
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think Python
item.description:
Think Python is an introduction to Python programming for beginners. It starts with basic concepts of programming, and is carefully designed to define all terms when they are first used and to develop each new concept in a logical progression. Larger pieces, like recursion and object-oriented programming are divided into a sequence of smaller steps and introduced over the course of several chapters.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 244 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think DSP
item.description:
Think DSP is an introduction to Digital Signal Processing in Python.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 164 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: SurviveJS React
item.description:
Learn React while building a Kanban application. Beginner-intermediate.
Author: Juho Vepsäläinen | Category: React
Lang: EN | Pages: 250 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: SurviveJS Webpack
item.description:
Learn webpack while building configuration and going through its features. Beginner-intermediate.
Author: Juho Vepsäläinen | Category: React
Lang: EN | Pages: 350 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The C Book, second edition
item.description:
This is not a tutorial introduction to C programming. The book is designed for programmers who already have some experience of using a modern high-level procedural programming language.
Author: Mike Banahan, Declan Brady and Mark Doran | Category: C/C++
Lang: EN | Pages: 333 | Year: 1991
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: ¡Aprende Haskell por el bien de todos!
item.description:
This is the spanish version of the book: Learn You a Haskell for Great Good.
Author: Álvaro Vilanova | Category: Haskell
Lang: ES | Pages: 400 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: JavaScript, ¡Inspírate!
item.description:
A simple and fun programming book that shows us how to program in JavaScript, from pseudocode to AJAX requests.
Author: Ulises Gascón | Category: JavaScript
Lang: ES | Pages: 149 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Sponsored book: Building APIs with Node.js
item.description:
Learn how to build scalable APIs using the Node.js platform and ES6 (EcmaScript 2015) with this quick, informative guide. Developing systems for the wide range of devices available in the modern world requires the construction of APIs designed to work only with data in a centralized manner, allowing client-side applications to be developed separately and have a unique interface for the final user.
Author: Caio Ribeiro Pereira | Category: Node.js
Lang: EN | Pages: 137 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Learn to Code HTML & CSS
item.description:
Learn to Code HTML & CSS is an interactive beginner’s guide with one express goal: teach you how to develop and style websites with HTML and CSS. Outlining the fundamentals, this book covers all of the common elements of front-end design and development.
Author: Shay Howe | Category: HTML
Lang: EN | Pages: 304 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Clean Code concepts adapted for Javascript
item.description:
Software engineering principles, from Robert C. Martin's book Clean Code, adapted for JavaScript. This is not a style guide. It's a guide to producing readable, reusable, and refactorable software in JavaScript.
Author: Ryan McDermott | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 11 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Python Basics
item.description:
Introduction to Python - Syntax, working with Shell commands, Files, Text Processing, and more.
Author: Sundeep Agarwal | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 119 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The Vim Tutorial and Reference
item.description:
A complete ebook about Vim Tutorial and Vim References.
Author: Steve Oualline | Category: Vim
Lang: EN | Pages: 804 | Year: 2007
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Programming in D
item.description:
This book aims to teach the D language to readers who are new to computer programming. Although having experience in other programming languages would certainly be helpful, this book starts from the basics.
Author: Ali Çehreli | Category: D
Lang: EN | Pages: 760 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Object-Oriented Programming in C
item.description:
Use ANSI C to discover how object-oriented programming is done, what its techniques are, why they help solve bigger problems, and how to harness generality and program to catch mistakes earlier.
Author: Axel Schreiner | Category: C/C++
Lang: EN | Pages: 221 | Year: 1994
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Clojure for the brave and true
item.description:
Complete, entertaining introduction to Clojure.
Author: Daniel Higginbotham | Category: Clojure
Lang: EN | Pages: 328 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Stuff Goes Bad: Erlang in Anger

It is first and foremost a collection of tips and tricks to help understand where failures come from, and a dictionary of different code snippets and practices that helped developers debug production systems that were built in Erlang.
Author: Fred Hebert | Category: Erlang
Lang: EN | Pages: 93 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Unix System Programming in OCaml

item.title: Free book: Angular 2 Succinctly
item.description:
Angular 2 is a massively popular JavaScript framework built to take advantage of component development in web apps. In Angular 2 Succinctly, author Joseph D. Booth will guide you through setting up a development environment, interacting with the Angular CLI, building Hello World, and more. By the end, you’ll know how to set up templates, compose components from those templates, and tie them all together with modules to deliver a cohesive web app.Angular 2 is a massively popular JavaScript framework built to take advantage of component development in web apps. In Angular 2 Succinctly, author Joseph D. Booth will guide you through setting up a development environment, interacting with the Angular CLI, building Hello World, and more. By the end, you’ll know how to set up templates, compose components from those templates, and tie them all together with modules to deliver a cohesive web app.
Author: Joseph D. Booth | Category: AngularJS
